text.p: These are the leading stories in the Egyptian press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Mubarak says in speech to mark Labour Day that Egypt has passed the transitional period and has built the foundation of a national boom that will take it into the next century. He says government tackled economic reform and terrorism without damaging democracy.
- Mubarak and Assad to meet today to discuss latest developments in the Middle East peace process and relations.
- Egyptian-U.A.E. talks dealt with bilateral cooperation in all fields. Both countries called for united Arab stand on regional issues and Israel's build-up of tension in Jerusalem.
- Economy minister tells Cairo University conference that 1.5 billion pounds will be spent on projects that will raise standard of living in provinces.

- Mubarak sends message with Foreign Minister Moussa to Tanzanian president. Tanzania wants Egyptian private sector to take part in its development projects; says there are many openings in fields of mining, agriculture and tourism.
- Mubarak and Arafat discuss Middle East peace process in telephone conversation; Arafat expected in Egypt within the next few days.
- Grand Sheikh of al-Azhar says he will donate his organs for transplantation after he dies.
